collaboratory-theme (0.0.9)

A Bootstrap 3 Theme for HBP Collaboratory Extensions

View on Gerrit View "Kitchen Sink" Example

Quick Install

Download the bootstrap.css or bootstrap.min.css files or install using Bower:

bower install collaboratory-theme

README

<h1 id="collaboratory-theme">collaboratory-theme</h1> <p>A Bootstrap 3 Theme for HBP Collaboratory Extensions</p> <h1 id="setup-collaboratory-theme">Setup Collaboratory Theme</h1> <p>This library package the HBP theme and Bootstrap so that you don&#39;t need to import both libraries.</p> <h2 id="install-with-bower">Install with Bower</h2> <p>Install the theme component using HBP Bower registry (<a href="http://bbpcode.epfl.ch/repositories/bower">http://bbpcode.epfl.ch/repositories/bower</a>).</p> <pre><code>bower install hbp-collaboratory-theme</code></pre> <h2 id="using-sass">Using Sass</h2> <p>Import <code>dist/sass/theme.scss</code></p> <pre><code class="language-scss"><span class="comment">// Assuming that `bower_components` is in your Sass import path</span> <span class="at_rule">@<span class="keyword">import</span><span class="preprocessor"> hbp-collaboratory-theme</span>/dist/sass/theme.scss</code></pre> <h2 id="using-css">Using CSS</h2> <p>Link to <code>dist/css/bootstrap.min.css</code></p> <pre><code>&lt;link rel=&quot;Stylesheet&quot; href=&quot;hbp-collaboratory-theme/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css&quot;&gt;</code></pre> <h2 id="javascript-dependencies">Javascript dependencies</h2> <p>A few Bootstrap components requires a counterpart javascript library. The loaded library depends of the underlying framework.</p> <p>Bootstrap jQuery plugin is included in this bundle as an optional dependency. If you are developing an angular based application, you need to rely on <code>angular-bootstrap</code> component instead.</p> <h3 id="angular-js-based-project">Angular JS based project</h3> <p>Install <code>ui.bootstrap</code></p> <pre><code>bower install angular-bootstrap</code></pre> <p>Require the module in your application.</p> <pre><code class="language-js"><span class="keyword">var</span> app = angular.module(<span class="string">'MyApp'</span>, [<span class="string">'ui.bootstrap'</span>]);</code></pre> <h3 id="jquery-based-proejct">jQuery based proejct</h3> <p>Include the <code>bootstrap.js</code> library in your HTML page.</p> <pre><code class="language-html">&lt;script src=&quot;./bower_components/collaboratory-theme/dist/javascripts/bootstrap.min.js&quot;&gt;</code></pre> <h1 id="usage">Usage</h1> <p>You can discover the look and feel of the theme by opening the kitchen sink page located at <code>./dist/examples/kitchen-sink.html</code>.</p> <p>This is just a theme over Bootstrap so all <a href="http://getbootstrap.com/">Bootstrap official documentation</a> apply and should be considered accurate.</p> <h1 id="development">Development</h1> <p>Run watcher and server using grunt:</p> <pre><code class="language-bash">grunt serve</code></pre> <p>You can then access a development server on <a href="http://localhost:8100">http://localhost:8100</a>.</p> <p>Each time a modification is detected, the corresponding files will be regenerated. If a Sass file is modified, the <code>dist</code> folder will be rebuilt as well, which means that you can link this project with other Bower enable development folder and have the change propagated.</p> <h1 id="credits">Credits</h1> <p>The project structure and build files are inspired by the <a href="http://code.divshot.com/themestrap/">Themestrap</a> template. The kitchen sink especially is a direct copy of a huge amount of work from this project. The main variation is that we use Bootstrap Sass instead of Less.</p>
